docs.lead_paragraph: President Bush said today that his doctors had given him a very good report about his thyroid, but earlier a spokesman said the President had been uncharacteristically tired. Mr. Bush, who will turn 67 years old on June 12, told reporters at the White House today, "I was dead tired" on Tuesday, but he said he now felt fine. The spokesman, Marlin Fitzwater, said Mr. Bush had scheduled time to rest and read between meetings, but not to take naps.

headline.main: Bush Tired, but Doctors Say His Health Is Fine
